title: Question about Yasuo, Can someone help me?
body: So when Yasuo is being attacked why is does he still build up his shield? I feel like they should take that part away. I mean he already gets a free shield when he lands his "hard" skill shot and ults. Its not hard to hit if you E and Q and knock a few people.

replies.body:
have you ever played him yourself?

by the way, his shield only triggers when its fully charged. so youre asking to change the shield mechanic to trigger the shield before the bar is full? even if he doesnt get the full shield, you realize that would make it a lot easier for him to absorb damage, since he would get a shield any time he just moved a few steps.

Full disclosure: I main Yasuo.


Pretty much what this guy says. Yasuo depends on that shield since his defenses are straight garbage, and since it only procs once his flow bar is full, it makes total sense for that bar to fill up whenever he's moving, regardless of what else is going on.

> [{quoted}](name=IronwallJackson,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=T0KIX4l2,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2015-11-06T16:03:47.942+0000)

> Pretty much what this guy says. Yasuo depends on that shield since his defenses are straight garbage, and since it only procs once his flow bar is full, it makes total sense for that bar to fill up whenever he's moving, regardless of what else is going on.

Other champions have worse defenses and they don't get a build up shield by just walking around, that doesn't decrease when they take any kind of dmg. He gets SO much free dmg from his kit its kinda crazy. When he ults he gets 50% armor pen. He then can increase the dmg of his dash by dashing. It increases up to 50% which does alot of dmg level 2 playing into a real squishy champion like {{champion:34}} {{champion:161}} {{champion:117}} {{champion:69}} . And then his passive is two different passives. He gets double Crit AND a shield. That just sounds like an overbearing kit.

None of those champions have to get into melee range to deal damage, while Yasuo most definitely does. That's the thing about melee AD carries; they need some way to survive close range engagements. Which is to say, survive getting to close range, then the onslaught on damage that's likely to come.

Range is the most powerful advantage one can have in a game, so how does one equalize things? By empowering those who lack it. That's why he has the situationally nuts gap closer, the shield, etc. Without those parts of his kit, he becomes unusable. Now, I'll concede that his crit multiplier isn't strictly necessary, but the rest of his kit is balanced around it. If that wasn't there, then he'd likely get a much higher base attack damage to compensate.

Also, his dash does crap damage, so it's hardly worth mentioning.

his dash does alot of dmg at level two when he takes a point into E. Cant literally make his enemy laner use flash my e and qing onto them

It does 70 damage assuming you have a single point in it and haven't charged it, which is less than you'll be doing with your Q. If you charge it to get the damage bonus, that'll rise to a maximum of 105 damage, which will admittedly do more damage than your Q unless the latter crits.

I'll concede that that is, in fact, quite a bit to a squishy champion during the earliest part of the game, but that's it. At all other points, E is strictly a mobility tool.
